data.title: Very good
data.text: The main reason I went there was for the bah mi sandwich which did not disappoint. The bread was fresh and perfect. The pork was tasty and made the sandwich a great take on the traditional one. The veggies were crisp and fresh. The seafood salad was fresh and delicious.

data.title: this place is heavenly
data.text: I love Pho and Asian flavored food.  This guys got it going on.  Everything is fresh and tastes like they picked it out of a garden that morning.  give it a try and let them season it.  if you don't like spicy then say you want it not spicy and you will have a nice experience with all the flavor and none of the heat.

data.title: Good bubble tea
data.text: I think this place is most known for its bubble tea, at least that is why I went there.  It is kind of hard to find and the inside can be crowded.  The staff was helpful.  I live across town from Banhwich and I only had the bubble tea when I went but defiantly worth the drive.

data.title: Great bubble teas
data.text: Lots to choose from. Smoothies and teas. I'm getting use to the boba teas. Mine was a black milk tea with coffee flavored boba. Good stuff

data.title: Delicious Sandwich and Bubble Tea
data.text: Saw some reviews and stopped here.  Definitely worth it. Sandwiches were tasty and lots of flavor.  Very surprised how good it was, especially for the price.  Only $5, what a deal.  Then tried the Bubble Tea, essentially a smoothie made from tea and fruit of your choice.   Our family loved it.

data.title: Tasty sandwiches
data.text: Today the restaurant was full of Banhwich fans. We enjoyed Grilled Beef, Spicy Thai Chicken, Teriyaki Chicken, and Mussaman Curry sandwiches, along with a peach smoothie and soft drinks. We liked it all, though the Spicy Thai Chicken was a little too spicy, while the Mussaman Curry was a little too bland. No problem -- we now know how to order next time!

data.title: Not to bad gf& vegetarian opt
data.text: Very small not well ventilated restaurant, but don't let that deter you as there is a few outside seats & take away. The kimchi was tasty but I will say it made for a messy deconstructed lettuce wrap. The teriyaki on a baguette was  pretty good but the last portion gets soggy (at least with take away). Overall I wouldn't call it my favorite place but I also don't regret going there. It's worth a try for a switch up of the classic sandwich.

data.title: Surprised!
data.text: I was delighted to find this cafe in Lincoln, what a surprise. They had a great menu, from desserts, bubble teas, and also banhmi. We tried the green waffle, the bubble teas, and of course the vietnamese sandwich. They were delicious!

data.title: Simple but delicious dining
data.text: This is the place to go if you love sandwiches and are ready for some different flavors. I had the sardine. It was scrumptious and the baguette it came on just right, the pickle vegetables was just right too. The teriyaki and chinese bbq pork sandwiches were good too. The pearl tea just refreshing. Yummy on all accounts,

data.title: Very good sandwiches
data.text: Had a #16 Korean BBQ Bandh Mi. sandwich with an added fried egg. It had BBQ beef, kim chee, spicy mayo, cilantro, jalapenos, pickled daikon and pickled carrots on a baguette. It was a flavor bomb and I loved it. At most places I have to add multiple sauces and seasonings to my sandwich to get it to this level. I would not change a thing on this sandwich. I had a strawberry bubble tea smoothie to wash down the sandwich. It was very good, but at over $4, a little bit pricy. For dessert I had a cheese cake bite and a Vietnamese green waffle. The cheese cake bite was  just that, a nice small bite size piece of nice creamy cheese cake. I wish more places did this so you could try multiple desserts at one visit. Lastly, the green waffle was light, warm, covered in alight coating of powdered sugar and delicious. It was the perfect end to my meal. I can not wait to come back and try more of their sandwiches. It is located in a small strip mall and has limited seating inside

data.title: Great Sandwiches
data.text: This was my second visit to Banhwich.   I had the Korean Bulgogi and it was awesome.    So many fresh flavor on a perfect roll.  It now on my list each visit to Lincoln.

data.title: Great spot
data.text: What a nice find! Unique sandwiches that are delicious. I feel like the menu has a little something for everyone. Plus bubble tea is always a good idea!

data.title: lettuce wraps and bubble tea on hot day
data.text: This place is known for the sandwiches, but I had a grilled beef lettuce wrap, and it was delicious. I loved the crisp, fresh vegetables and tasty meat, served with a tangy sauce. Jackfruit bubble tea was a perfect ending to this meal.

data.title: Great Sandwiches
data.text: First of all, if you don't like chinese or vietnamese cuisine, you probably will not like this place.  This is basically that kind of fair, except on a sandwich, rather than on rice.  The food is very good and the veggies are fresh.  I would recommend this place to anyone who enjoys cuisine from abroad.

data.title: I live here.
data.text: Best sandwich place in town.  This should be in the top 10.  Not a bad sandwich on the the menu.  If you're in town come eat here.

data.title: Not one bad sandwich
data.text: Tried 4 different types of sandwiches and they were all excellent! Place is a little small but still comfortable. Bubble tea is excellent. Try the taro flavor.

data.title: Not For Most of Us
data.text: My family typically appreciates spicy food but most didn't like their sandwich.  My wife had the Teriyaki Chicken while my sons and I had the Thai chicken and beef.  To be fair, one of my sons thought highly of his sandwich.  On another positive note I really enjoyed the Mango bubble tea with tapioca.

data.title: Soooo yummy!
data.text: Stop in all the time for lunch. Always delicious flavors and such reasonable prices! Staff aren't always super fast when the owner is away, but still tasty. Wish they had a south location.

data.title: Mmmm.... our new lunch stop traveling
data.text:
My husband and I drive through the area on our 14 hour trip to see his family and this is a new favorite!!

He had the mussaman tofu and I had the spicy chicken. Both were wonderful, fresh and flavorful. My chicken was so tender! We also had the squid salad which was perfectly refreshing. Cucumbers, thinly sliced squid and a light marinade. I had a coffee boba also.

I was impressed watching them press fresh sugar canes.

Excellent!!

data.title: Great little place
data.text: Didn't really know what to expect from a Vietnamese sandwich place, but wanted to try.  LOVED it.  Wonderful selection of sandwiches all served on crispy hoagie type buns, probably 20 plus varieties, all served warm.  We had the Thai spicy Chicken, and the BBQ Pork.  Really delicious. Served with chip and drink, very reasonable.  Outdoor seating for the nice days, and indoor seating for the rest.  About 20 varieties of bubble tea as well, including Vietnamese Coffee with coffee flavored bubbles.  Pretty nice little place, definitely going back.
